column5: looking for some product,, that will clean algea and water spots off alum boats ,, thanks to anyone who replies thankx
To keep you boat looking good I suggest a mixture of Vinegar and water. It works great on boats. As for the algae get it real wet first and let the vinegar soak in a bit before wiping it off.Russ
I've used lime-a-way with excellent results, and will try the vinegar thing next-It's a lot cheaper!
I've used a product called "Zing", it's much like Lime-a-Way but made specifically for painted aluminum boats. It's acidic and does a great job on water spots.
Just did the vinegar clean for the first time - works great, and leaves a nice shine - gets the water spots off as good as anything. I used a 50% mix. Too bad about the smell...
Zing is great stuff, follow the directions closely, and have plenty of rinse water on hand, it will discolor the paint
